engines, asking for their views on Google's business practices by Feb. 11. The Commission is expected to take several months to digest the feedback. Google on Monday reiterated that it was co-operating with the regulator. There's always going to be room for improvement, so we'll be working with the Commission to address any concerns, spokesman Al Verney said. Google Chief Executive Eric Schmidt told Britain's Sunday Telegraph in an interview that the company was keen to avoid a lengthy legal battle.

Within technology circles, the move by Google Inc. -- born during the first dot-com boom-- to replace CEO Eric Schmidt with the 38-year-old Page left some wondering how the search giant would deal with middle age. Founder becoming CEO... Is this like a Steve Jobs returning or a Jerry Yang returning? Chris Dixon, a technology veteran who has invested in Skype and Foursquare, tweeted. This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit, said Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat, the Italian auto company. lined up against any change in benefits for Social Security and have begun warning Barack Obama to avoid the entitlement debate in his State of the Union address. Sen. Bernie Sanders says he counts Harry Reid among his allies in this fight: The battle lines are forming within the Democratic Party over the charged question of reforming Social Security in the days leading up to Barack Obama 's State of the Union address.
